title: User Interface
summary:
In the realm of artificial intelligence, the User Interface (UI) serves as the component that enables interaction between users and the expert system. It provides a platform for users to input queries, receive system outputs, and interact with the system's functionalities.

The User Interface of an expert system often includes:
Input Mechanism: Allows users to enter queries, data, or information into the system. This can involve text input, forms, voice recognition, or other input methods.
Output Display: Presents the system's responses, recommendations, solutions, or any other relevant information in a format understandable to the user. This might include text-based outputs, visual representations, or other forms of communication.
Navigation and Controls: Provides options, menus, or controls for users to navigate through the system, access different functionalities, or perform specific actions.
Feedback and Interaction: Offers feedback mechanisms that help users understand the system's responses or reasoning, as well as ways to interact or modify the queries based on the system's feedback.

The User Interface aims to make the expert system accessible and user-friendly, allowing users to interact with and benefit from the system's intelligence within a specific domain. It serves as the bridge between the user and the complex processes running within the expert system.
